channel.title: BBC News

item.title: World first epilepsy device fitted in UK boy's skull
item.description: Oran, who is 13, was sometimes having hundreds of seizures a day due to his severe epilepsy.

item.title: Deadly attacks on synagogue and churches in Russia's Dagestan
item.description: Unidentified gunmen in the southern Russian republic kill 15 police officers and at least six gunmen die in clashes.

item.title: Hungary's Varga stable after going off on stretcher
item.description: Hungary striker Barnabas Varga is stable in hospital after being carried off on a stretcher following a mid-air collision in their Euro 2024 match against Scotland.

item.title: Are renters a new electoral coalition?
item.description: Margaret Thatcher had Essex Man and New Labour boasted Mondeo Man. Now it's the turn of Renter Ruth.

item.title: More people investigated over election bet claims
item.description: The regulator is looking at other people with links to the Conservative Party, Chris Mason writes.

item.title: At least 1,301 people died during Hajj - Saudi Arabia
item.description: Most were unregistered pilgrims who walked long distances in intense heat, officials said.

item.title: Stars take over Paris for sporty Vogue fashion show
item.description: Supermodels, singers and sports star took to the runway in Paris as Vogue turned a square into a runway.

item.title: Grounded flights rearranged after Manchester Airport chaos
item.description: A power cut caused cancellations of departures and arrivals at Manchester Airport.

item.title: Yellow heat-health alerts set for most of England
item.description: A yellow heat-health alert will be issued for most of England from 08:00 BST on Monday.

item.title: No sign of Jay Slater after days of searching Tenerife
item.description: Police are scouring ravines in the the Spanish island for the 19-year-old, who vanished last Monday.

item.title: Huge plume of smoke as firefighters tackle industrial estate blaze
item.description: Loud explosions were heard and a large plume of smoke was drifting towards Glasgow after the fire broke out.

item.title: Two arrested on murder charge after holiday park death
item.description: A man, aged in his 70s, is found dead in Heron Lake, Crossways, just after midnight on Sunday.

item.title: Ros Atkins: Is Brexit still important to voters?
item.description: The BBC's analysis editor looks at whether Brexit is still a key issue for general election voters.

item.title: Labour avoids saying it will scrap proposed gender lessons ban
item.description: Bridget Phillipson says draft guidance has some "good" parts but "other elements" are "too partisan".

item.title: Swinney: Parliament stamps not used for campaign
item.description: The first minister responds to fresh claims about SNP parliamentary resources being used for campaigning.

item.title: Cleverly says aide called Rwanda policy 'crap' for effect
item.description: The Tory candidate - who worked for the home secretary - was heard making the remark at an event.

item.title: Sir John Curtice: Biggest parties down in polls, as Reform narrows gap
item.description: Our favourite number cruncher Sir John Curtice looks at how the parties are doing as the general election looms nearer.

item.title: Offensive remarks by several Reform candidates revealed
item.description: The comments included remarks about murdered MP Jo Cox and a black reality TV contestant.

item.title: Who should I vote for and what are the parties promising?
item.description: Explore the manifestos of the main parties in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland and compare their policies on key issues with this interactive guide.

item.title: Labour don't believe the polls - and they don't want you to either
item.description: Labour is quietly preparing for government - even if many of them still don't believe they can win.

item.title: All parties face £4bn social care 'hole' in England
item.description: Labour, Tory and Lib Dem plans for social care reform in England are not fully costed, the IFS says.

item.title: Farage defends Ukraine comments after Starmer and Sunak criticism
item.description: Nigel Farage is accused of being on the side of the Russian president by his Tory, Labour, Lib Dem and SNP rivals.

item.title: Meet five of the youngest election candidates: 'I haven’t got my A-level results yet'
item.description: An 18-year-old who hasn't had his A-levels results yet is among those standing in the general election.

item.title: JK Rowling accuses Labour of abandoning women
item.description: Labour says it is "the party of women's equality" after the author criticises Sir Keir Starmer on trans rights.

item.title: Attack on candidate's service record sad - Starmer
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer criticises Conservative candidate Johnny Mercer who accused his rival of lying.

item.title: Tories pledge focus on pubs and clubs in 'first 100 days'
item.description: The Conservative Party says it would review licencing laws in a bid to boost the night-time economy.

item.title: Tories and Labour pressed on two-child benefit cap in BBC Wales debate
item.description: Plaid Cymru and Welsh Lib Dems urge next UK government to scrap the limit, during live TV debate.

item.title: Labour far ahead of Tories in election donations
item.description: Labour raised nearly £4.4m in the second week of the campaign, way ahead of the Tories' £292,500.

item.title: Election poll tracker: How do the parties compare?
item.description: How do people say they will vote in the UK general election? Our poll tracker measures the trends.

item.title: Families want party pledges on 'terror attack' laws
item.description: Survivors and relatives of those killed urge commitments on venue security and caring for victims.

item.title: Impassioned Question Time audience puts leaders on the spot
item.description: The BBC's chief political correspondent analyses the key moments of Thursday's Leaders' Special.

item.title: What are the parties saying about housing? - Your questions
item.description: Our cost of living correspondent answers your questions about housing and personal finance.

item.title: The Papers: Labour 'changing gender plans' and 'betting investigation widens'
item.description: Labour's plans to ease transition rules and claims of a broader election betting investigation lead the papers.

item.title: Gareth Jenkins: An 'unreliable god' at the heart of the Post Office scandal
item.description: Why the former Fujitsu engineer is such a key figure in the Post Office scandal.

item.title: How islanders are saving their Indian Ocean coral reef
item.description: Conservationists have found a way to restore a reef off one of Zanzibar's islands.

item.title: Edmonton Oilers thrill ice hockey fans with historic comeback
item.description: The NHL team could break Canada's 31-year Stanley Cup drought in a make-or-break Game 7 against the Florida Panthers.

item.title: I almost died trying to get salt from the sea
item.description: Darren Peattie put everything into his dream of harvesting sea - at massive risk to his health.

item.title: 'It's utter chaos': Video shows huge crowds stuck in darkness at terminal
item.description: One passenger describes seeing people climbing over one another after a major power cut hit the airport.

item.title: You've probably never heard of the biggest band at Glastonbury
item.description: They're the biggest-selling act in the world, and they're about to play the Pyramid Stage.

item.title: Hungary's Csoboth scores in 100th minute to break Scottish hearts
item.description: Watch as Hungary's Kevin Csoboth scores the winner deep into stoppage time to knock out Scotland in their final group game at Euro 2024 in Stuttgart.

item.title: Daku given two-game ban after offensive chants
item.description: Albania forward Mirlind Daku has been banned for two matches after leading his country's fans in derogatory chants.

item.title: Pundits must remember tournaments are tough - Kane
item.description: England captain Harry Kane says former internationals who are now pundits should "remember what it’s like to wear the shirt".

item.title: Who needs what to reach Euro 2024 last 16?
item.description: Every side has now played at least twice at Euro 2024. BBC Sport takes a look at the state of the group stage and tells you who needs what to qualify.

item.title: Are England 'too tired to press'? Six key charts
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the data on how tired England's players might be and their lack of pressing at Euro 2024.

item.title: Pitch invaders seeking selfies a 'concern' as Uefa steps up security
item.description: Fans invading the pitch to try to take selfies with players is "a concern", says Portugal manager Roberto Martinez.

item.title: 'With pressure on, De Bruyne delivers a masterclass'
item.description: When Belgium needed him most captain Kevin de Bruyne delivers yet another masterclass, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: VAR: Should Simons goal for Netherlands have counted?
item.description: Netherlands boss Ronald Koeman insists Xavi Simons' disallowed goal should have stood in the 0-0 draw against France at Euro 2024.

item.title: England performance 'flat' and 'confused', BBC Sport pundits say
item.description: Should the players take responsibility? Are England missing Jordan Henderson? Will Anthony Gordon play? The England inquest rolls on.

item.title: England have 'put too much pressure on ourselves'
item.description: Declan Rice says England have “put too much pressure on ourselves” after the 1-1 draw with Denmark in their second group game at Euro 2024.

item.title: 'England are about to really feel the pressure'
item.description: Ex-England captain Alan Shearer explains why it is better for Three Lions players to stay in the bubble at their team camp to deal with criticism over their performances at Euro 2024.

item.title: 'Heartbroken' Tierney ruled out for rest of Euro 2024
item.description: Scotland defender Kieran Tierney is left "heartbroken" after being ruled out of Euro 2024 with the hamstring injury picked up against Switzerland.

item.title: Child star, social media icon - time to shine at Euro 2024?
item.description: Child star, teen social media icon and now wanted by Europe's top clubs, is it time for Xavi Simons to star for the Netherlands at Euro 2024?

item.title: The awkward questions behind Hungary's football revival
item.description: Hungary have ridden back into contention for international honours on the back of billions of euros and one man's passion for football.

item.title: 'Baffling and concerning' - what is wrong with England?
item.description: England's draw with Denmark was "baffling and concerning" according to the pundits, but what exactly is going wrong for the Three Lions?

item.title: Highlights: England play out frustrating 1-1 draw with Denmark
item.description: Watch highlights as England play out a frustrating 1-1 draw with Denmark in their second Group C game of Euro 2024 in Frankfurt.

item.title: Why aren't politicians talking about social care?
item.description: In England, the care system is struggling but the main parties have steered away from detailed plans.

item.title: Would Labour’s private school tax plan work?
item.description: A teacher and former policy adviser at the Department for Education discuss Labour’s proposed policy.

item.title: China is the true power in Putin and Kim’s budding friendship
item.description: There are signs President Xi disapproves of his allies' alliance, the BBC's China correspondent says.

item.title: Bar chart wars: What to watch out for on leaflets telling you who can win your seat
item.description: It’s a two-horse race here, leaflets put out by political parties often claim. Can you trust them?

item.title: Huge Saudi construction projects 'might get scaled down'
item.description: Funding concerns are expected to see Saudi Arabia reduce its giant building schemes.

item.title: England thrash USA to secure semi-final place
item.description: England charge into the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup with a ruthless 10-wicket thrashing of the United States.

item.title: Woman attacked by wolves in safari park near Paris
item.description: The victim, who was staying at a nearby lodge, strayed into the car-only safari zone at Thoiry park.

item.title: Glastonbury Festival as seen from the sky
item.description: James Pearce, a Somerset-based paraglider, shared images of the site from thousands of feet up.

item.title: Potter and Swift racers thrill Ally Pally crowd
item.description: Teams create the wackiest homemade soapboxes, relying on gravity to navigate the downhill course.

item.title: In pictures: Saturday at The Isle of Wight Festival
item.description: Saturday saw a headline set from the Pet Shop Boys, as well as performances from S Club and Jessie J.

item.title: Man's joy at Northern Lights and glowing plankton sea shots
item.description: Photographer Lee McGrath waited hours to capture the amazing phenomenon on the south Wales coast.

item.title: 'Scotland stunned, sickened, suckered and out of Euros'
item.description: The footballing gods have had their fun with Scotland again as their Euro dreams die, writes Tom English.

item.title: Scotland boss Clarke furious at '100% penalty' denial
item.description: Furious Scotland head coach Steve Clarke has railed against the decision not to award his side a penalty as they crashed out of Euro 2024.

item.title: Lack of quality or wrong approach - what cost Scotland?
item.description: BBC Sport's pundits reflect on where it went wrong for Scotland after their Euro 2024 campaign comes to a crashing halt.

item.title: Hometown hero Jordan takes England to 'crunch time' in Barbados
item.description: England bowler Chris Jordan stars on the return to his birthplace Barbados to help his team into the T20 World Cup semi-finals.

item.title: Download now
item.description: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

item.title: Fiona Bruce presents a two-hour leaders' special from York
item.description: Fiona Bruce presents a two-hour leaders' special from York.

item.title: Electioncast: What're the odds? Alleged election betting and undecided punters
item.description: And Laura gets her hands on an internal Labour memo to candidates.

item.title: Ukraine war: The men avoiding conscription
item.description: Many draft-eligible Ukrainians are hiding from mobilisation squads

item.title: How does government borrowing work?
item.description: How does government borrowing work, and how and when is the money paid back?

item.title: When will mortgage rates come down?
item.description: Bank of England interest rates affect mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions of people.

item.title: How quickly are prices rising in the UK?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen from record highs, meeting the 2% target.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your mortgage
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Three ways to win the rental property race
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Five hacks to help save money on your food shop
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: Five hacks to help save money on your food shop
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: When will mortgage rates come down?
item.description: Bank of England interest rates affect mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions of people.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your mortgage
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Three ways to win the rental property race
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Fact v fiction: Five tips for saving petrol money examined
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: Two arrested on murder charge after holiday park death
item.description: A man, aged in his 70s, is found dead in Heron Lake, Crossways, just after midnight on Sunday.

item.title: Earl 'would like' to transfer Lough Neagh ownership
item.description: The Earl of Shaftesbury says he would transfer ownership "into a charity or community trust model".

item.title: Polling day is dehumanising, says blind voter
item.description: Elin Williams does not expect to be able to vote independently - like every election so far.
